programme.name: Master in Business Administration (MBA)
programme.about: This programme is aimed at providing in-depth understanding to students in technical, human and conceptual skills necessary for a successful manager with specialization in Financial Management, Marketing Management, Human Resource and System Management. The teaching strategy is oriented towards application of knowledge with live cases and teaching aids. A six weeks summer internship programme is included after completion of first year to develop business acumen. Students also interact regularly with industry/academia personalities and undergo industrial visits.

eligibility_criteria.relaxation: 5% or 0.5 CGPA/CPI relaxation for SC/ST candidates
eligibility_criteria.final_year_candidates: Eligible to apply; provisional admission until degree completion

selection_process: Screening of applications based on entrance exam scores (CAT/CMAT/GMAT/MAT/Institute Test)
Performance in Group Discussion (GD) and Personal Interview (PI)

programme_education_objectives: Integrate functional areas of business knowledge across disciplines and synthesize functional business knowledge within strategic organizational framework.

Illustrate ability to apply critical thinking and ethical decision making to complex business problems and exhibit competence in applying interpersonal and managerial skills within an institutional context.
Demonstrate ability to motivate others to achieve strategic outcomes and create an orientation of personal responsibility, respect and professionalism.
programme_outcomes: Use systems thinking to describe how core concepts in each functional area relate to and are integrated across disciplines.
Identify appropriate processes for making organizational decisions.
Demonstrate ability to bring disparate functional areas of business to bear on the formulation of organizational strategy.
Identify and describe core concepts in the key functional areas of business.
Recognize and explain appropriate analytical methods for solving discipline-specific business issues.
Construct a reasoned critique of an organizational decision.
Apply critical thinking skills in making an organizational decision.
Relate relevant ethical frameworks to the resolution of a business dilemma.
Display proficiency in building a persuasive case.
Show ability to manage organizational constituencies.
